alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 25 at 11:44PM MDT until May 26 at 12:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Quay County in east central New Mexico... Northeastern Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 1245 AM MDT. * At 1144 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of San Jon to 7 miles west of Wheatland, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Quay, San Jon, Grady, Ragland, Glenrio, Broadview, Wheatland, Bellview, Forrest and Bard. This includes Interstate 40 near Mile Marker 308, and between Mile Markers 341 and 373. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
